title: Microsoft Corp. stock underperforms Monday when compared to competitors
text:
Shares of Microsoft Corp. 
        MSFT,
        -0.17%
       shed 1.35% to $405.65 Monday, on what proved to be an all-around rough trading session for the stock market, with the S&P 500 Index 
        SPX,
        +0.11%
       falling 0.32% to 4,942.81 and Dow Jones Industrial Average 
        DJIA,
        +0.12%
       falling 0.71% to 38,380.12. The stock's fall snapped a two-day winning streak. Microsoft Corp. closed $9.67 short of its 52-week high ($415.32), which the company reached on January 31st. The stock underperformed when compared to some of its competitors Monday, as Apple Inc. 
        AAPL,
        -1.06%
       rose 0.98% to $187.68, Alphabet Inc. Cl C 
        GOOG,
        +0.21%
       rose 0.97% to $144.93, and Alphabet Inc. Cl A 
        GOOGL,
        +0.04%
       rose 0.91% to $143.68. Trading volume (25.0 M) remained 447,046 below its 50-day average volume of 25.5 M. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights, an automation technology provider, using data from Dow Jones and FactSet.  See our market data terms of use. Something unusual happened in the stock market this quarter: Both the S&P 500 and Cboe Volatility Index, better known as the Vix, rose.
